questions.question: The striking workers have decided to ……………………….. the meeting for an indefinite period.
questions.description: To put off is to postpone.

questions.question: The President ………………………… the leader of the party that won the most seats to form the government.
questions.description: To call upon is to invite.

questions.question: The manager is faced with more problems than he can easily ………………………..
questions.description: To get over is to overcome.

questions.question: The doctor advised the patient to …………………………….. smoking.
questions.description: To give up is to stop.

questions.question: The travelers …………………………. very early in the morning.
questions.description: To get up is to rise from bed.

questions.question: The patient had ………………………….. before the doctor arrived.
questions.description: To pass away is to die.

questions.question: He faced his enemy bravely but in the end he had to ……………………….
questions.description: To give in is to surrender.

questions.question: The job will …………………………… very little of your time.
questions.description: To take up is to consume or occupy.

questions.question: Please ………………………… the files carefully.
questions.description: To go through is to examine.

questions.question: The firemen worked hard for hours to ……………………….. the fire in the factory.
questions.description: To put out is to extinguish.

questions.question: It was his carelessness that ……………………………. the accident.
questions.description: To bring something about is to cause it to happen.

questions.question: I …………………………… an old friend of mine yesterday.
